metadata.dc:author: Prados Peña, D
Navarro Rivera, M C
Cruz Quintana, F
García Caro, M P
Riovalle, J S
metadata.dc:description: The authors publish data which refer to a study carried out on a sample of 350 nursing professionals in the Granada hospital network, subdivided into two groups: a risk group (GR) and a non-risk group (NR). The authors analyze the results obtained relative to the presence of stress in situations of agony and death, as well as the family as an object for professional treatment in both study groups.
metadata.dc:title: Enfermería, familia y paciente terminal.
[Nursing, family, and terminally ill patients].
